fields.value: Behavioral Surveillance Survey (FSW, CFSW, MSW, CMSW) - 2006 (By TAI)

dsDescriptionValue.value: Multiple rounds of Behavioral Surveillance Survey (BSS) (termed as BTS for other survey) were planned as a major component of the overall evaluation strategy to measure the outcomes of Avahan intervention among KPs (FSW, MSW, CFSW, CMSW) population most at risk) in terms of coverage as well as provide data on changes in risk behviors and prevalence of STIs including HIV in IBBA and Non-IBBA intervention districts of Tamil Nadu. The primary objectives of the BSS were, firstly to obtain measures on behavior indicators for observing trends in high-risk behavior among selected sub-population groups. Secondly, to obtain qualitative diagnostics on the trends and explain the behavior across the key groups wherever required.

keywordValue.value: Advocacy, Behavioral tracking surveys with FSWs, Behavioral tracking surveys with MSM, CFSW, CMSW, Community mobilization, FSWs, HIV, MSWs, Sexual behavior; INSTITUTION: TAI; STRATEGIC AREAS: Clients of FSWs, FSWs, High risk MSM

FSW, CFSW, High risk MSW, CMSW

fields.value:
The Behavioral Surveillance Survey -2006  in Tamil Nadu was conducted among FSWs, Clients of FSWs, Men who have sex with men, and their clients in eight districts (e.g. Dindigul, Erode, Karur, Namakkal, Tanjore, Theni, Trichy
& Vellore) . Participants were selected using different probability sampling methods (Conventional cluster sampling, time-location cluster sampling, take all and respondent driven sampling etc.) .  Details of the methodology are given in the report that was uploaded along with data.  About 2399 FSWs, 1197  MSWs, 1480 CFSWs and 737 CMSWs were interviewed in each district to enable tracking of changes in key HIV risk behaviors.
